intro: Ouratea cocleensis, commonly known as the Coclean Ouratea, is a flowering plant species native to Central America. It belongs to the family Ochnaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, lowland forest environments, often as an understory species. Its fruit is a drupe that contains a single seed, and it plays a role in local ecosystems by providing food for various wildlife. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in some regions.
